channel.title: The Night Air - Program podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Night Air: listening for pleasure; an audio adventure in ideas, sounds and music remixed around a theme. It's a listening experience animated by dub versions of ABC Radio National's distinctive programming. Obliquely connected material is re-assembled with sonic glue, letting the listener's imagination build a new story. It's a space to find the music in speech and the poetry in ideas, a show that invites you to take time to unravel the usual media tangle.
channel.description: The Night Air: listening for pleasure; an audio adventure in ideas, sounds and music remixed around a theme. It's a listening experience animated by dub versions of ABC Radio National's distinctive programming. Obliquely connected material is re-assembled with sonic glue, letting the listener's imagination build a new story. It's a space to find the music in speech and the poetry in ideas, a show that invites you to take time to unravel the usual media tangle.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012, Australian Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved.
channel.itunes:author: ABC Radio National
channel.itunes:summary: The Night Air: listening for pleasure; an audio adventure in ideas, sounds and music remixed around a theme. It's a listening experience animated by dub versions of ABC Radio National's distinctive programming. Obliquely connected material is re-assembled with sonic glue, letting the listener's imagination build a new story. It's a space to find the music in speech and the poetry in ideas, a show that invites you to take time to unravel the usual media tangle.

item.title: Egypt
item.itunes:subtitle: From the revolutionary protests in Tahrir Square  to the ancient temples of Abu Simbel come on a tour through Cairo’s chaotic traffic back into antiquity.
item.description: From the revolutionary protests in Tahrir Square to the ancient temples of Abu Simbel come on a tour through Cairo’s chaotic traffic back into antiquity.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Conflict
item.itunes:subtitle: The Night Air meets the beast that allegedly no story can do without - conflict. While we're riding into the battle we also hear that far off voice that says, 'none of this is necessary...defuse, resolve, live'. It's a thoroughly conflicted edition.
item.description: The Night Air meets the beast that allegedly no story can do without - conflict. While we're riding into the battle we also hear that far off voice that says, 'none of this is necessary...defuse, resolve, live'. It's a thoroughly conflicted edition.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: When the Arkestra came to town
item.itunes:subtitle: Sun Ra's Arkestra brought news of Saturn to Melbourne.
item.description:
In June 2011 the Sun Ra Arkestra rolled into Melborne for that city's International Jazz Festival.
It was the first time the musical emissaries of the space jazz pioneer Sun Ra had reached this part of the planet.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Learning to be dead
item.itunes:subtitle: We can never actually know death... we can only imagine.
item.description: We can never actually know death... we can only imagine.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Activate
item.itunes:subtitle: Putting the demo back into democracy
item.description: Putting the demo back into democracy. As traditional political options wither we re-consider the art of activism and meet some of those tough visionaries, feral philosophers and rowdy ratbags who despite all odds hold a passion for change.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Protest, non-violence, Malcolm X, Charles Perkins, activism

item.title: Psyched in
item.itunes:subtitle: waking up on the ceiling
item.description: Have you ever stopped to think that you don't really know how you got where you are now?
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: astral travel, psychic power, telepathy, superstition, meditation, cognition, psyche, ESP

item.title: Vinyl Retentive
item.itunes:subtitle: As digital technology continues its rendering of the entire planet into hi-res simulacra there are still hold outs - rebels who insist on the lingering charms of ‘outmoded’ formats - like vinyl records.
item.description: As digital technology continues its rendering of the entire planet into hi-res simulacra there are still hold outs - rebels who insist on the lingering charms of ‘outmoded’ formats - like vinyl records.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Shopping
item.itunes:subtitle: Relax and listen to that lovely supermarket muzak.
item.description: Shopping has it all - labour exploitation, weird science, ugly packaging - contemporary products reach us with all sorts of strings attached. This evening we present a guide to surviving 21st century shopping without your moral compass spinning too wildly. In fact, just relax and listen to that lovely supermarket muzak. In the golden aisles of The Night Air mall you can hear the sound of violins...
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Brazil
item.itunes:subtitle: Carmen Miranda, futebol and part-myth
item.description: It was the French leader Charles de Gaulle who infamously said, ‘Brazil is not a serious country’ - but we take it seriously (and not forgetting to break into a joyful samba from time to time).
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Brazil, Peter Robb, Carmen Miranda, futebol, football, cinema novo, feijoada

item.title: Tropical
item.itunes:subtitle: The Night Air gets hot and languid as we tour the tropics.
item.description: This evening things get hot and languid in The Night Air as James Vyver takes you on a tour of the tropics.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Tread
item.itunes:subtitle: The Little Desert and the moon
item.description: Once upon a time, stepping into this continent was one of those small steps for man. Especially when The Little Desert got stepped on—you could easily miss it even though it held numerous species of wildlife.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: desert, moon landing, moon, tesla, edison, war of the currents, len beadell, soil, apollo 11, mary leakey, bipedalism, woomera, rocket range

item.title: Slow
item.itunes:subtitle: We consider the seductiveness of slow.
item.description: In the furious pace of today’s wired world it’s sometimes necessary to change down a few gears and alter your perceptions of time’s passing. This evening we consider the seductiveness of slow.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Displaced
item.itunes:subtitle: Squatters, buskers, refugees and other eternal wanderers.
item.description: We’re taking to the street in search of the various ways people are displaced. Squatters, buskers, refugees and other eternal wanderers.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Dark Pool stories
item.itunes:subtitle: Audio stories of darkness as found on ABC Pool.
item.description: This evening the Night Air is telling audio stories of darkness as found on ABC Pool.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Voodoo
item.itunes:subtitle: The voodoo you do possesses us all. Moses Iten digs deep into Vodou music and pulls audio fetishes from dark hiding places to conjure up tales of Zombie Makeup and the pin-pricked ragdoll of Voodoo Economics
item.description: The voodoo you do possesses us all. Moses Iten digs deep into Vodou music and pulls audio fetishes from dark hiding places to conjure up tales of Zombie Makeup and the pin-pricked ragdoll of Voodoo Economics
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Voodoo, Haiti, Voudon, New Orleans, Cuba, Congo, Sudan, Brazil

item.title: Tribute to John Blades
item.itunes:subtitle: John Blades was a tireless champion of 'marginal' culture. We pay tribute to the radio producer, disability advocate and tape loop artist.
item.description: John Blades was a tireless champion of 'marginal' culture. We pay tribute to the radio producer, disability advocate and tape loop artist.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: John Blades, The Loop Orchestra, Disabilities, Multiple Schlerosis, The Too Hard Basket, Sound, The Scarlet Road, Background Noise

item.title: Radio World
item.itunes:subtitle: To celebrate UNESCO’s World Radio Day the Night Air gets ethereal and tunes into the spectres of the spectrum.
item.description: To celebrate UNESCO’s World Radio Day the Night Air gets ethereal and tunes into the spectres of the spectrum.
item.itunes:author: Sherre DeLys

item.title: Really Rare
item.itunes:subtitle: Extinct, disappearing or just highly elusive, we’re on the trail of the antique and the apocryphal but also an almost mythological beast like the Tasmanian tiger – has it gone or is it just hiding.
item.description: Extinct, disappearing or just highly elusive, we’re on the trail of the antique and the apocryphal but also an almost mythological beast like the Tasmanian tiger – has it gone or is it just hiding.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: rare, extinct, bunyip, tasmanian tiger, museum victoria

item.title: Identities
item.itunes:subtitle: The Night Air explores Identities - Indigenous and otherwise.
item.description: The Night Air explores Identities - Indigenous and otherwise.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Aboriginal culture, Indigenous identity, Australian identity

item.title: Vectors
item.itunes:subtitle: Following lines in the sand, puzzling about crop circles and looking for the geographical and psychological markers that keep us right on track with magnitude and direction.
item.description: Following lines in the sand, puzzling about crop circles and looking for the geographical and psychological markers that keep us right on track with magnitude and direction.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: vectors, rubik, convergence, atlantis, erik von daniken, colin amery

item.title: Vocal Chords
item.itunes:subtitle: In this Night Air we open the voice box to strum the many chords of the voice.
item.description: In this Night Air we open the voice box to strum the many chords of the voice.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Paranoid Parade
item.itunes:subtitle: In the first part of this evening's show we take a nervous shuffle down a Cold War cul de sac.
item.description: In the first part of this evening's show we take a nervous shuffle down a Cold War cul de sac.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Unforgettable
item.itunes:subtitle: We try to remember what it was like to forget: deja vu and nostalgia, amnesia and mnemonics, implanted memories and oral testimony, we tie a knot in our handkerchief, take a sprig of rosemary and dive deep in the river of oblivion, exploring the twin human virtues of memory and forgetfulness.
item.description: We try to remember what it was like to forget: deja vu and nostalgia, amnesia and mnemonics, implanted memories and oral testimony, we tie a knot in our handkerchief, take a sprig of rosemary and dive deep in the river of oblivion, exploring the twin human virtues of memory and forgetfulness.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Soul and Body
item.itunes:subtitle: Your soul is singing and that tingling, harmonic minor-scale sensation down your spine, the boom-boody-boom as your heart beats and the clanging in your head all add up to a great symphony made on, around and within the body.
item.description: Your soul is singing and that tingling, harmonic minor-scale sensation down your spine, the boom-boody-boom as your heart beats and the clanging in your head all add up to a great symphony made on, around and within the body.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Soul, soul music, James Brown, African Americans, Body Music, symphony of the body, Annie Sprinkle, body percussion, Annalise Friend, rhythm

item.title: Revolving
item.itunes:subtitle: In a cyclic mood this evening as we consider reflections and reverberations across a range of media - from the CT scanner, to the sound therapist, to the carousel.
item.description: In a cyclic mood this evening as we consider reflections and reverberations across a range of media - from the CT scanner, to the sound therapist, to the carousel. We explore the sonic therapeutic potential of Tibetan bowls, we get inside the head of a speaking photo booth and there's a music box with a mind of its own.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough

item.title: Birthday wishes
item.itunes:subtitle: It's time to celebrate!
item.description: It's time to celebrate! Whether it's your birthday or a remarkable day in history, in this party edition we're celebrating famous birthdays, speeches, people, places and historical moments in times. So put your glad rags on, turn it up and make a toast to Birthdays and Anniversaries. Hip Hip Hooray!
item.itunes:author: Regina Botros
item.itunes:keywords: Anniversary, birthday, happy birthday, celebration, birthday party

item.title: Forest
item.itunes:subtitle: In this evening's Night Air we're seeing the forest and the trees!
item.description: In this evening's Night Air we're seeing the forest and the trees!
item.itunes:author: Regina Botros

item.title: Graffix
item.itunes:subtitle: It's about having a quick doodle, chatting with the inventor of Bugs Bunny and the inventor of Ren and Stimpy.
item.description: It's about having a quick doodle, chatting with the inventor of Bugs Bunny and the inventor of Ren and Stimpy. There's also a chat with people who scrutinise handwriting to see if someone can be trusted, and there's a bit of manga, a bit of graffiti, a visit to the tattoo parlour and a little bit of boop boop be doop, Betty Boop.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: graphic, tony cohen, tattoo, illustrated man, bugs bunny, anime, chuck jones, ren and stimpy, printing, typeography, font, cartoon, drawing, adam elliot, claymation

item.title: Lost Australia+Ship Ahoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Musician and producer Kevin Purdy trawls the dusty archives to find ways of reanimating nagging memories of Australian social rituals now consigned to history.
item.description: Musician and producer Kevin Purdy trawls the dusty archives to find ways of reanimating nagging memories of Australian social rituals now consigned to history.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Lost Australia, social history, social rituals, Kevin Purdy, Purdy, Historical Opera, Wayne Funnell, Ship Ahoy, discovery of Australia, Lore of the Old West, cowboys, cowboys songs, cowboy stories, Roy Rogers

item.title: Sombra Verde and Taman Negara
item.itunes:subtitle: Brisbane-based field recordist and sound artist Lawrence English takes us deep into the jungles of the Amazon for a poetic account of the environment.
item.description: Brisbane-based field recordist and sound artist Lawrence English takes us deep into the jungles of the Amazon for a poetic account of the environment.
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
item.itunes:keywords: Amazonia, Jungle, sound recording, field recordings, Lawrence English, Room 40, Taman Negara National Park, jungle night walk, Johan Dalgas Frisch, Trans-Amazonian Highway

item.title: Time
item.itunes:subtitle: Time ... perforated perceptions of the past?
item.description: Time ... perforated perceptions of the past? The inconceivable potential of the future? The impossibility of grasping the moment? Sure, all of the above but what is time to us? It shapes us - by turning up ripe, rotten or premature. We will time to turn back, speed up or stop. We fantasise about a world where time has no power. Yet the clock ticks on, with or without you...
item.itunes:author: Brent Clough
